title: Authors and Citation
text: Steffen Ehrmann. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Ehrmann S (2024). clueRIO: Input/Output management CLUMondo scenarios. R package version 0.0.1, http://ehrmanns.github.io/cluerio, https://github.com/luckinet/cluerio.
code: @Manual{,   title = {clueRIO: Input/Output management for CLUMondo scenarios},   author = {Steffen Ehrmann},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.1, http://ehrmanns.github.io/cluerio},   url = {https://github.com/luckinet/cluerio}, }

title: Input/Output management for CLUMondo scenarios
text: CLUMondo model dynamic, spatially explicit, land use land cover change model. clueRIO manages input/output setting file-structure required successfully configuring running CLUE model. acts interface enables users build document scenarios based models quickly script-based fashion. --date version typically command line version. R-package aim simplify specifying files needed successfully run version. Please make sure reference R-package, also references website particular Van Asselen, S., Verburg, P.H., 2013. Land cover change land-use intensification: simulating land system change global-scale land change model. Global Change Biology 19, 3648–3667.

title: Input/Output management for CLUMondo scenarios
text: Install official version CRAN: Install latest development version github:
code: # install.packages("clueRIO") devtools::install_github("luckinet/clueRIO")

title: Input/Output management for CLUMondo scenarios
code: library(clueRIO)  data_dir <- system.file("test_datasets", package = "clueRIO", mustWork = TRUE)  regions <- st_read(dsn = paste0(data_dir, "/example_region.gpkg")) |>    mutate(region = "somewhere")  # landSystems <- tibble(ID = c(), system = c())  minimal <- clue_scene(   name = "2lus_1demand_minimal",    period = c(2000, 2019),   root = tempdir(),    description = "this is a minimal showcase where two landuse ...")  # first, specify the land system basis ... minimal <- minimal |>    clue_landsystems(file = paste0(data_dir, "/landuse.tif"),                     regions = regions,                     cats = landSystems)  # ... then the drivers used to determine patterns minimal <- minimal |>    clue_driver(file = paste0(data_dir, "/cropland_suit.tif"),                name = "suitCrop") |>    clue_driver(file = paste0(data_dir, "/forest_suit.tif"),                name = "suitFor")  # set land types up minimal <- minimal |>    clue_landtype(name = "forest", resistance = 0.5,                 suitability = tibble(driver = "suitFor",                                       coef = 1)) |>    clue_landtype(name = "cropland", resistance = 0.5,                 suitability = tibble(driver = "suitCrop",                                       coef = 1),                  production = tibble(commodity = "crops",                                      amount = 1))  # set commodities up minimal <- minimal |>    clue_commodity(name = "crops",                   demand = tibble(year = c(2000:2019),                                   region = "somewhere",                                   amount = seq(from = 4760, to = 5000, length.out = 20)))  minimal <- minimal |>    clue_conversion(from = "forest", to = "cropland", label = "intensification")  # possibly adapt options # clue_options(...)  # initiate the model clue_initiate(scene = minimal)  # possibly check whether everything is set up properly # clue_validate(scene = minimal)  # and finally run the model clue_run(scene = minimal)

what: clueRIO: Input/Output management for CLUMondo — clueRIO-package
title: clueRIO: Input/Output management for CLUMondo — clueRIO-package
text: CLUMondo model dynamic, spatially explicit, land use land cover change model. clueRIO manages input/output setting file-structure required successfully configuring running CLUE model. acts interface enables users build document scenarios based models quickly script-based fashion.

title: clueRIO: Input/Output management for CLUMondo — clueRIO-package
text: Please check link information CLUMondo model. --date version typically command line version. R-package aim simplify specifying files needed successfully run version. Please make sure reference R-package, also references website particular Van Asselen, S., Verburg, P.H., 2013. Land cover change land-use intensification: simulating land system change global-scale land change model. Global Change Biology 19, 3648–3667.

title: clueRIO: Input/Output management for CLUMondo — clueRIO-package
text: Maintainer, Author: Steffen Ehrmann steffen.ehrmann@posteo.de

text: Set commodities attributes

text: scene description name character(1) name commodity. demand data.frame(1) table , much commodity produced. Must names year, region amount.

title: Set a conversion rule — clue_conversion
text: function constructs conversion one land type.

title: Set a conversion rule — clue_conversion
code: clue_conversion(   scene,   from,   to,   label = NULL,   thresh = NULL,   auto = NULL,   mask = NULL )

title: Set a conversion rule — clue_conversion
text: scene description character(1) land type conversion shall created. character(1) land type conversion shall created. label character(1) description conversion (used sequence plot). thresh integerish(1) number time steps land type must remain can change land type . auto integerish(1) number time steps land type automatically change . mask character(1) name driver (see clue_driver) conversion specified class allowed.

what: Build an example CLUE scene — clue_example
title: Build an example CLUE scene — clue_example
text: function helps setting example scene certain step.

title: Build an example CLUE scene — clue_example
code: clue_example(path = NULL, until = NULL, verbose = FALSE)

title: Build an example CLUE scene — clue_example
text: path character(1) scene default root directory tempdir(), want particular location, specify argument. character(1) step scene shall built, one ..., verbose logical(1) verbose building example scene (default FALSE).

title: Build an example CLUE scene — clue_example
text: return value, called side effect creating example scene specified path.

title: Build an example CLUE scene — clue_example
code: if(dev.interactive()){ # to build the full example database clue_example(path = paste0(tempdir(), "/myScene"))  # to make the example database until a certain step clue_example(path = paste0(tempdir(), "/myScene"), until = "")  }

title: Set land types and their attributes — clue_landtype
text: scene description name character(1) name land type. resistance numeric(1) relative conversion resistance land change. limit integerish(1) number time steps land-use type allowed remain location . suitability data.frame(1) table driver coefficient suitability. Must names driver coef. Driver names must correspond names defined clue_driver. production data.frame(1) table , priority much land type produces. Must names commodity, priority amount.

title: Set land types and their attributes — clue_landtype
text: Additional details...

what: Set options of the current model run — clue_options
title: Set options of the current model run — clue_options
text: Set options current model run

title: Set options of the current model run — clue_options
code: clue_options(   iter_mode = NULL,   conv1 = NULL,   conv2 = NULL,   out_type = NULL,   rs_reg = NULL,   ls_hist = NULL,   neigh = NULL,   loc_pref = NULL,   dyn_lusmat = NULL,   out_write = NULL,   iter_param = NULL,   protected = TRUE )

title: Set options of the current model run — clue_options
text: iter_mode integerish(1) Iteration mode: 1 = convergence criteria expressed absolute values, 2 = yet implemented conv1 numeric(1) First convergence criterion. conv2 numeric(1) Second convergence criterion. out_type integerish(1) Choice type output file: 0 = headers output file, 1 = ArcGIS headers, -2 = headers suppress information log-file, 2 = ArcGIS headers suppress information log-file, 3 = ArcGIS/ArcMap extension headers (default) rs_reg integerish(1) Region specific regressions. 0 = different regressions different regions (default), 1 = different regressions different regions, 2 = different regressions different regions. ls_hist integerish(2) Initialization land use history: 0 = read file age, 1 = generate random number + standard seed (default), 2 = merely random number options 1 2, additional value maximum number years random numbers must given. neigh integerish(1) Neighbourhood function (yet implemented): 0 = (default), 1 = simulation (automatically chosen use setNeighbourhood), 2 = influences calculated, simulation loc_pref integerish(1) dyn_lusmat integerish(1) Dynamic landuse matrix (yet implemented): 0 = (default), 1 = out_write integerish(1) Write selected output measures: 0 = , 1 = final year (default), 2 = years iter_param numeric(1) Choice stability vs. speed convergence. Value 0.001 0.1, higher values leading stable likely solution lower values leading faster less likely solution. protected logical(1) whether consider protected areas (gridded object 'protected' given). (implemented yet)

title: Set options of the current model run — clue_options
text: return value, called side-effect setting model options.

title: Crop rotation modifier — mod_crop_rotation
text: Crop rotation modifier

code: mod_crop_rotation()

title: Crop rotation modifier — mod_crop_rotation
text: implement crop rotations, 'locspec' files adapted year. yearly 'locspec' calculated selecting subset pixels, depending sign weight factor. case sign negative, keep pixels covered focal class previous time-step thus -weigh present previously. case sign positive, keep pixels covered classes previous time-step thus -weigh present previously.
